item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "They came to know the incorrigible sorrow of all prisoners and exiles, which is to live in company with a memory that serves no purpose." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Without memories, without hope, they lived for the moment only. indeed, the here and now had come to mean everything to them. For there is no denying that the plague had gradually killed off in all of us the faculty not of love only but even of friendship. Naturally enough, since love asks something of the future, and nothing was left us but a series of present moments." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Always there comes an hour when one is weary of one's work and devotion to duty, and all one craves for is a loved face, the warmth and wonder of a loving heart." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
Jennifer add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "It has always seemed strange to me...The things we admire in men, kindness and generosity, openness, honesty, understanding and feeling, are the concomitants of failure in our system. And those traits we detest, sharpness, greed, acquisitiveness, meanness, egotism and self-interest, are the traits of success. And while men admire the quality of the first they love the produce of the second." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "Being at ease with himself put him at ease with the world." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "It’s all fine to say, “Time will heal everything, this too shall pass away. People will forget”—and things like that when you are not involved, but when you are there is no passage of time, people do not forget and you are in the middle of something that does not change." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "It was deeply a part of Lee's kindness and understanding that man's right to kill himself is inviolable, but sometimes a friend can make it unnecessary" -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "Ford... you're turning into a penguin. Stop it." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "For a moment, nothing happened. Then, after a second or so, nothing continued to happen." -- Douglas Adams
